titles.title: Schoolgirl Strikers: Animation Channel
スクールガールストライカーズ アニメーション チャンネル
sgs
スクールガールストライカーズ Animation Channel
Schoolgirl Strikers
Schoolgirl Strikers
스쿨걸 스트라이커즈 Animation Channel

anime.description: * Based on the card collecting mobile game with JRPG and Visual Novel influences Schoolgirl Strikers by http://anidb.net/cr1130 [Square Enix]. The newly established private high school for girls, Goryoukan Academy, has a hidden face that people on the outside don`t know about... Mysterious apparitions called Oburi have appeared from a rift in space-time. The only ones capable of fighting this enemy of mankind are girls known as Strikers, who have the ability to sense the fifth dimension. Goryoukan Academy is actually an organization that seeks out girls who are more than meets the eye and trains them up for the Fifth Force, a combat force created to subjugate the Oburi. The story of the battles and friendships of five girls who comprise the newly assembled team Altair Torte is about to begin! Source: crunchyroll

externalentity.identifier: スクールガールストライカーズ

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: parallel world
tag.description: A parallel world, parallel universe, or alternative reality is a self-contained separate reality coexisting with our own. Because "alternative reality" sometimes implies that the reality is a variant of our own, like for example a mirror world, we use the term "parallel world/universe" which is more general, without any connotations implying a relationship (or lack thereof) with our own world/universe (meaning a fictional world can just as well have an alternative reality, it doesn`t need to be our reality). To put it more simply, this category is to show if more than 1 world/universe/reality is present in the anime. Multiple timelines of the same world/universe/reality are NOT considered parallel worlds. For example, in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate] the cast travels through multiple "World Lines", which are defined as parallel timelines of the same universe had various events occurred with differing outcomes.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: faceless alien invasion
tag.description: Uncommunicative, faceless aliens suddenly invade Earth from outer space or a parallel world thus causing a war with humans. If the humans are lucky, the invasion may go off without a war that would cause untold destruction and death.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: skiing
tag.description: Skiing is a recreational activity and competitive sport in which the participant uses skis to glide on snow. Popular school excursion destination in winter is a ski resort, a town or village in the mountains where students do skiing, snowboarding and other winter sports.

tag.name: teamwork
tag.description: A cooperative effort by the members of a group or team to achieve a common goal.

tag.name: in medias res
tag.description: In medias res, also medias in res (Latin for "into the midst of affairs (lit. into mid-affairs)"), refers to a literary and artistic technique where the narrative starts in the middle of the story instead of from its beginning. It is generally a plot-driven concept rather than a character-driven one; though characters are commonly used to provide the backstory. The characters, setting, and conflict are often introduced through a series of flashbacks or through characters relating past events to each other. Probably originating from an oral tradition, the technique is a convention of epic poetry, one of the earliest and most prominent examples in Western literature being Homer`s Odyssey and Iliad. Virgil`s Aeneid began the tradition in literature of imitating Homer, continued in Torquato Tasso`s Jerusalem Delivered, John Milton`s Paradise Lost and "Inferno" from Dante`s Divine Comedy. George Lucas`s Star Wars saga was told using in medias res.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: sense of foreboding
tag.description: The anime starts off quietly, everything seems to be fine, but from episode to episode the signs that something ominous is about to happen increase. E.g. a typical mystery setting.

tag.name: alien invasion
tag.description: An alien invasion or space invasion is the invasion of the Earth by an extraterrestrial species, usually but not necessarily sentient and highly advanced technologically. The invasion typically happens for reasons such as to exterminate and supplant human life, to enslave the earthlings or harvest them for food, to steal the planet`s resources, or simply to destroy it altogether. It often happens during, causes, or is the result of a war between humans and aliens.

tag.name: Gainax bounce
tag.description: A term that has come to describe often exaggerated, very jiggly, fluid, and painstakingly detailed animation of female characters` bouncing breasts. The term has its roots in http://anidb.net/a185 [Top o Nerae!] — Gunbuster, Gainax`s first OVA (1988), in which the Gainax bounce is found unabated in the three female characters of Noriko, Kazumi, and Jung.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 登場! ウワサの美少女探偵
Arrived! The Beautiful Detective Everyone`s Talking About
La jolie détective apparaît
Toujou! Uwasa no Bishoujo Tantei
episode.summary: The five girls in Altair Torte are living together in the team house in Eterno. They talk about the new physics teacher while eating. She has a strange aura about her and Tsubame wonders if she has anything to do with the O`bli. Tsubame and Yuumi then talk about a beautiful detective that is going around solving the school`s mysteries. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 結成! アルタイル・トルテ
Formed! Altair Torte
La formation d`Altaïr Torte
Kessei! Altair Torte
episode.summary: Tierra reminisces about when the members of Altair Torte first meet each other. Tsubame is still worried because she doesn`t have any memories, except for a mysterious dream. The other team members also learn about the true purpose of Goryoukan Academy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 特訓! そして初めての勝利
Train! And Our First Victory
Entraînement ! Notre première victoire
Tokkun! Soshite Hajimete no Shouri
episode.summary: Tsubame is depressed that the team is not measuring up to snuff, and suggests that everyone start training to get better. After consulting with everyone, each member comes up with an idea of their own on how to do a better job. Wacky hijinks ensue until the O`bli appear... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出撃! フィフス・フォース
Deploy! Fifth Force
En avant, Escadron 5 !
Shutsugeki! Fifth Force
episode.summary: The Goryoukan Academy for Girls. This school has a secret. Girls are scouted and added to the Special-Ops Unit called Fifth Force, an organization dedicated to fighting the O`bli. Four girls, Satoka, Io, Yuumi, and Mana, are investigating a rumor at the school to find a ghost, but Altair Torte, a new team within Fifth Force, is called to action! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決! 降神三姉妹
Showdown! The Three Origami Sisters
Affrontement ! Les sœurs Origami
Taiketsu! Koushin San Shimai
episode.summary: The members of the Fifth Force are on alert now that humans are appearing on their patrols, not just the O`bli. Mana knows the three girls that have been threatening them, and wants to try to help, but get into a fight anyway. But things don`t seem to be going very well for either party. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! 二つの強敵
Clash! The Two Formidable Enemies
Confrontation ! De formidables adversaires !
Gekitotsu! Futatsu no Kyouteki
episode.summary: Satoka is asked by a girl to help her search for an item she dropped, but Satoka is instead confused by the girl`s odd behavior. That night, Altair Torte decides to preform a more hand-on training in fifth dimensional space. They start running with their equipment on, but suddenly a girl clad in a black costume attacks them! She calls herself the Knight of the Black Swan, Odile, but what is this girl really after?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 急襲! SF大作戦
Raid! SF Super Plan
À l`attaque ! La stratégie SF
Kyuushuu! SF Daisakusen
episode.summary: Altair Torte deploys to investigate a strange O`bli signature. The location of the signature is deep in the mountains, with a beautiful lake, and the team starts wanting to enjoy the scenery while they`re on their mission. Yuumi loves to cook, and is enticed by the large amount of mountain vegetables available, while Io changes into her swimsuit to search underwater, only to be inspected by an elated Mana. They finish their investigation, and Tierra gives the all clear, so the five of them decide to enjoy their time with Mother Nature. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白熱! チーム対抗戦
White Hot! Team Battle
Combats acharnés entre équipes
Jinetsu! Team Taikousen
episode.summary: Fifth Force occasionally has a round-robin tournament in order to improve their combat capabilities. It`s Altair Torte`s first time participating in the tournament, and with their difference in experience clear, they quickly lose the first match. After the match, the members talk about the reason they lost, and come to the conclusion that they have to use novel tactics to make up for their lack of experience. Yuumi helps come up with a plan, but will their sneak attack succeed...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 急転! 消えた三姉妹
Change! The Three Sisters Have Disappeared
Grand retournement ! Les trois sœurs disparues
Kyuuten! Kieta San Shimai
episode.summary: The team realizes that the O`bli can now travel into the real world, which opens up many implications for the safety of humanity. Meanwhile, the Origami sisters seem to have disappeared, and no one knows where they could have gone. It`s only a matter of time before Morgana shows up again, too... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦慄! 大雪山に未確認生物を見た
Hair-raising! Unidentified Creature Spotted in the Snowy Mountains
La terrifiante créature non identifiée des neiges !
Senritsu! Ooyukiyama ni Mikakuninseibutsu o Mita
episode.summary: Tsubame and the others get a day off as the dust has settled. Yuumi uses her connections to go to a hot spring deep in snow-covered mountains, and Mana and a few of the other girls set out to find a yeti. Little do they know there seems to be real evidence to support their existence. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 参上! 孤独の騎士
Arrived! The Lone Knight
Visite de la guerrière solitaire !
Sanjou! Kodoku no Kishi
episode.summary: Odile finally makes her move, and announces that she`s going to steal Fifth Force`s Stella Prism. The team manages to figure out her true identity, but Odile is way too strong to handle, either way. Will they be able to talk things out with her? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青春! 紅の決闘
Youth! The Crimson Duel
Duel pourpre de la jeunesse !
Seishun! Aka no Kettou
episode.summary: The three Origami sisters start living alone togehter. Times are tough, and they`re having trouble scraping together the money they need to eat. The sisters start going to school at Goryoukan Academy, and Mana is excited to make friends with them. Akara doesn`t seem to like the additional attention she`s getting from everyone, and ends up getting in a fight with Amane, the leader from a team she accidentally took out instead of Altair Torte. Just what will happen...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! フィフス・フォースよ永遠に
Final Battle! Fifth Force Forever
Conclusion ! L`Escadron 5 pour toujours
Kessen! Fifth Force yo Eien ni
episode.summary: Everyone at Fifth Force is fighting to save the real world from the O’bli, while Tsubame takes on Morgana alone. Altair Torte moves to find Tsubame to help her, with assistance from Odile. It’s come down to the wire, but will Fifth Force be able to save everyone? Source: crunchyroll
